intro: Tephrosia valleculata, commonly known as the mountain tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being ovate to elliptic in shape. The flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, usually appearing in shades of white or pale yellow.
